full_summary:
# Request for Proposal

## Official Title and Description

The Department of Justice Canada is seeking to engage the services of up to three (3) bilingual Senior ATIP Advisors, with expertise in processing complex and high-profile ATIP requests.

## Tender Details

* Reference Number: PW-22-01016892-1
* Solicitation Number: 1000031151-001
* Publication Date: December 13, 2022
* Tender Closing Date: January 25, 2023, 14:00 EST
* Amendment Date: January 5, 2023

## Brief Description

The Department of Justice Canada requires the services of Senior ATIP Advisors to address the backlog of ATIP requests and process complex files and/or complaints resulting from surges in workload. The successful advisor(s) will apply their expertise in the processing of ATIP requests, exercising a high degree of judgement, discretion, and analysis in preparing, handling, and disclosing sensitive information.

## Key Requirements

* Bilingualism (English and French) is a requirement for the Senior ATIP Advisor(s)
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail are essential for processing large volumes of routine and complex request files
* Ability to work independently to meet deadlines and communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders
* Familiarity with electronic document management systems, redaction tools, and MS Office Suite is essential
* Compliance with security requirements and regulations is mandatory

## Trade Agreements

This requirement is subject to the provisions of the following trade agreements: Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), and World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA).

## Contract Details

* Contract duration: From date of award until December 31, 2027 inclusive
* Estimated level of effort: Unknown – Task Authorization Contract for services as and when required
* Initial contract value: $2,080,000.00 including taxes, split evenly between the number of awarded contracts

## Contact Information

Kayla Pordonick
Contact Email: [Kayla.Pordonick@justice.gc.ca](mailto:Kayla.Pordonick@justice.gc.ca)
Phone Number: 613-301-9709

Please note that this requirement is part of the Task and Solutions Professional Services (TSPS) method of supply, which is subject to quarterly refresh cycles. If you are interested in becoming a qualified supplier, please contact SPTS.TSPS@TPSGC
